intro: Molopospermum peleponnesiacum subsp. bauhini, commonly known as the Peloponnese molopospermum, is a rare flowering plant native to the Peloponnese region of Greece. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
